title: Bush City
subText: Step outside into Bush City – a living, growing exhibition.

paragraph.title: NULL
paragraph.text: Take a short walk through some of the natural wonders of New Zealand, from native bush to volcanic landscape.

paragraph.title: Native Bush
paragraph.text: Head to the bush! With over 1,400 native plants you can take a condensed tramp through New Zealand’s jungle-like forests. You might even see a tūī or other birds in the bush.

paragraph.title: Volcanic landscape
paragraph.text: Explore examples of Aotearoa’sAotearoa’s New Zealand’s volcanic landscape – clamber up a lava flow and layered ash falls from the central North Island’s volcanoes.

paragraph.title: Fossil Dig
paragraph.text: Are you a budding palaeontologist? Uncover a giant fossilised mosasaur (marine reptile) replica at our fossil dig.

paragraph.title: Limestone Cave
paragraph.text: Venture underground, down dark passageways dripping with water and lit by glow-worms. Here you’ll find stalactites, cave wētā, and the bones of extinct flightless moa. Our limestone cave is inspired by the Waitomo caves.

paragraph.title: Oldest Rocks
paragraph.text: Check out the oldest exhibits at Te Papa. You can even climb on these colourful rocks – some date back almost 600 million years!
